body: @shaneing Thanks for filing this. Does the model file exist in your FTP file store?

> @shaneing Thanks for filing this. Does the model file exist in your FTP file store?

Sorry, I have updated the issue. Please review it again.

@shaneing 

I wasn't able to reproduce the issue. Here's my code to log and load a pytorch model.

``````python
"""
# Command to setup an FTP server:

```
docker run -d --name ftpd_server -p 21:21 -p 30000-30009:30000-30009 -e "PUBLICHOST=localhost" \
    -e FTP_USER_NAME=mlflow -e FTP_USER_PASS=mlflow -e FTP_USER_HOME=/home/mlflow stilliard/pure-ftpd
```

Ref.: https://github.com/stilliard/docker-pure-ftpd
"""

import os
import random
import string
import torch

import mlflow
import mlflow.pytorch


def train_torch_model():
    # https://pytorch.org/tutorials/beginner/pytorch_with_examples.html#pytorch-nn
    N, D_in, H, D_out = 64, 1000, 100, 10
    x = torch.randn(N, D_in)
    y = torch.randn(N, D_out)
    model = torch.nn.Sequential(
        torch.nn.Linear(D_in, H),
        torch.nn.ReLU(),
        torch.nn.Linear(H, D_out),
    )
    loss_fn = torch.nn.MSELoss(reduction='sum')
    learning_rate = 1e-4
    for t in range(500):
        y_pred = model(x)
        loss = loss_fn(y_pred, y)
        model.zero_grad()
        loss.backward()
        with torch.no_grad():
            for param in model.parameters():
                param -= learning_rate * param.grad

    return model


def get_random_string(length):
    # https://pynative.com/python-generate-random-string/
    letters = string.ascii_lowercase
    return ''.join(random.choice(letters) for i in range(length))


expr_name = get_random_string(32)
artifact_location = "ftp://mlflow:mlflow@0.0.0.0:21/mlruns"

if mlflow.get_experiment_by_name(expr_name) is None:
    mlflow.create_experiment(expr_name, artifact_location)

mlflow.set_experiment(expr_name)


with mlflow.start_run():
    print('mlflow version:', mlflow.__version__)
    print('tracking URI:', mlflow.get_artifact_uri())
    print('artifact URI:', mlflow.get_tracking_uri())

    model = train_torch_model()
    mlflow.pytorch.log_model(model, 'model')
    uri = mlflow.get_artifact_uri()

    loaded_model = mlflow.pytorch.load_model(os.path.join(uri, "model", "model"))
    print(loaded_model)

``````

output:

```
mlflow version: 1.9.2.dev0
tracking URI: ftp://mlflow:mlflow@0.0.0.0:21/mlruns/7752bfdfb0df4c058e7f4fd422100562/artifacts
artifact URI: file:///Users/harutakakawamura/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlruns
Sequential(
  (0): Linear(in_features=1000, out_features=100, bias=True)
  (1): ReLU()
  (2): Linear(in_features=100, out_features=10, bias=True)
)
```
@shaneing Can you share your code to log a pytorch model?

@shaneing 
I was able to reproduce the same error by executing `mlflow.pytorch.load_model` against an empty directory. Could you check the model file exists in your FTP file store by running `ls /path/to/model_dir`?

> @shaneing
> I was able to reproduce the same error by executing `mlflow.pytorch.load_model` against an empty directory. Could you check the model file exists in your FTP file store by running `ls /path/to/model_dir`?

I have located the problem.  It will occur error when `ftp.nlst` return files with the absolute path. I am using image `bogem/ftp`.
@shaneing I was able to reproduce the same error with `bogem/ftp`.

I have the same problem. Changing the FTP Server resolved this particular issue. But when I register my model I can't used the downloaded registered model from the FTP sever.

I opened the above issue for this.
@harupy it's easy to fix this error by `list(map(lambda x: os.path.basename(x), artifact_files))`.
